title.narrative: COVID-19 ProValAB/Agricultural valorization of small dams in Burkina Faso
COVID-19 Valorisering av dammar Burkina Faso

description.narrative:
New/additional funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The project aims to assure an improved agricultural valorization of hydraulic infrastructure already in place in Burkina Faso. The project aims at both rehabilitating 17 to 20 of Burkina Faso's many water dams and improve the use of the dams. The overall expected objective of the project is: "Households sustainable development of food security/nutritional security and increase of their incomes by exploiting water from small dams through the development of beneficial value chains".
The specific objectives are : • users put in place good governance for the sustainable management of infrastructures, water resources and developed lands; • farmers increase quantitatively and qualitatively their agricultural, forestry, pastoral and fishery production (ASPF) ; • producers and other players in value chains improve their economic and social performance.
The project runs in its totality over 5 years, where a first phase (2017-2020) is financed in collaboration between the Government of Burkina Faso and Sweden. Sweden contributes XX million SEK.
The contribution is is in line with the following goal of the strategy for Sweden's development cooperation in Burkina Faso "... to help boost incomes and improve security among the poor, especially among women and girls, by promoting environmentally sustainable increases in productivity in the natural resource management sectors." Further, the contribution is of a vital importance for Burkina Faso's capacity to adapt to climate change.
The project contributes to at least eight of the seventeen sustainable goals stated by the United Nation in 2015 and signed both by Sweden and Burkina Faso. It is also in coherence with several public policy objectives of Burkina Faso such as the National Plan for Economic and Social Development (NPESD) adopted in 2016 and the development strategy SCADD. It is further in line with the National Adaptation Program of Action on Climate Change (NAPA). ProValAB falls within the framework of the implementation of the National Water Policy by considering the National Program for Integrated Water Resources Management and the National Hydro Development.
In Burkina Faso around 85% of the population gain their living from natural resources, agriculture, livestock and silviculture. This is more so in the rural areas where the incomes are very low, however these livelihood activities still contributes to around 40% of the Gross Domestic Budget (GDP). The most limiting factor to increase the productivity of natural resources is the access to water. With climate change the rainfall have become more irregular and more intense once it occurs, which means that the risk of soil erosion increases, that the topsoil disappears and the possibility to keep the humidity in the soil diminish. The dams allow farmers to produce an important supplement of vegetables and fruits, which in addition will increase their cash income and make them more market-oriented. It should also improve nutrition and health status of the farmers' families.

Nya medel/medeltillägg för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Projektets övergripande mål är att uppnå ett mer effektivt och rättvist nyttjande av existerande regnvattendammar för jordbruksändamål i Burkina Faso. De specifika målen är:
1) Användarna skapar system för god och hållbar förvaltning av dammarna, vattenresursen och odlingsmarken; 2) Odlarna ökar sin kvantitativa respektive kvalitativa produktion från träd, jordbruk, husdjur och fiskodling; 3) Producenter och andra värdekedjeaktörer förbättrar sitt ekonomiska och sociala uppträdande.
Projektet löper över 5 år under vilka fas 1 (2017-2020) samfinansieras av Burkina Faso och Sverige. Sverige avser bidra med 79 000 000 miljoner kronor.
Projektet överensstämmer med minst åtta av de sjutton hållbara utvecklingsmål som fastställdes av FN 2015 och som undertecknats av både Sverige och Burkina Faso. Projektet överensstämmer också med den nationella planen för ekonomisk och social utveckling (NPESD), utvecklingsstrategin SCADD, den nationella planen för adaptering till klimatförändringarna (PANA) och landets prioriteringar inom resiliens för livsmedelssäkerhet och nutrition antagen 2015.
I Burkina Faso lever omkring 85% av befolkningen, främst på landsbygden, av naturresurser, jordbruk, boskap och skogsbruk. Inkomsterna är mycket låga, men trots detta bidrar dessa försörjningsaktiviteter till cirka 40% av BNP. Den mest begränsande faktorn att öka produktiviteten av naturresurser är tillgången till vatten. Med klimatförändringen har nederbörden blivit mer oregelbundet och mer intensiv när det inträffar, vilket innebär att risken för jorderosion ökar, att översta jordlagret försvinner och möjligheten att hålla fuktigheten i jorden minskar. Dammarna tillåter jordbrukare att producera ett viktigt tillskott av grönsaker och frukter, vilket dessutom kommer att öka sina kontantinkomster och göra dem mer marknadsinriktade. Det kommer att leda till att förbättra böndernas hushåll närings- och hälsotillstånd.

tag.narrative: 1.2 - By 2030, reduce at least by half the proportion of men, women and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions according to national definitions.
1.2 - Till 2030 minst halvera den andel män, kvinnor och barn i alla åldrar som lever i någon form av fattigdom enligt nationella definitioner.

1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.

13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.

15.8 - By 2020, introduce measures to prevent the introduction and significantly reduce the impact of invasive alien species on land and water ecosystems and control or eradicate the priority species.

15.8 - Senast 2020 införa åtgärder för att förhindra införseln av invasiva främmande arter och avsevärt minska deras påverkan på land- och vattenekosystem samt kontrollera eller utrota prioriterade arter.

2.3 - By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous peoples, family farmers, pastoralists and fishers, including through secure and equal access to land, other productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment.

2.3 - Till 2030 fördubbla jordbrukets produktivitet och inkomster för småskaliga livsmedelsproducenter, i synnerhet kvinnor, ursprungsfolk, familjejordbrukare, boskapsskötande nomader samt fiskare, inklusive genom säker och lika tillgång till mark, andra produktionsresurser och insatsvaror, kunskap, finansiella tjänster och marknader samt möjligheter till värdeskapande och sysselsättning utanför jordbruket.
3.3 - By 2030, end the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis, malaria and neglected tropical diseases and combat hepatitis, water-borne diseases and other communicable diseases.
3.3 - Senast 2030 utrota epidemierna av aids, tuberkulos, malaria och försummade tropiska sjukdomar samt bekämpa hepatit, vattenburna sjukdomar och andra smittsamma sjukdomar.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
6.6 - By 2020, protect and restore water-related ecosystems, including mountains, forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers and lakes.
6.6 - Senast 2020 skydda och återställa de vattenrelaterade ekosystemen, däribland berg, skogar, våtmarker, floder, akviferer och sjöar.
7.1 - By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services.
7.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa allmän tillgång till ekonomiskt överkomliga, tillförlitliga och moderna energitjänster.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

title.narrative: Amendment 3_1 to 51200044 ProValAB by Sweden Embassy letter
Amendment 3_2 to 51200044 ProValAB by Government letter
Decision for Call-off 51200044 ProValAB 2020&2021 annual audit

description.narrative: Cooperation between the Embassy and the partner In 2020, the cooperation between the Embassy and the partner worked well. It resulted in follow-up actions and various administrative exchanges as part of the implementation of the project. Capacity of the partner and of his collaborators to carry out activities ProValAB Management Unit team has good project implementation capacity. However, it should be noted that there is a significant overload of work in certain positions (Expert in monitoring and evaluation; administrative and financial manager; socio-economist engineer); which may hinder the achievement of the expected results. Examples of the results that have been achieved, both expected and unexpected in 2020 : The main results obtained in 2020 are given according to the components of the project. Regarding the sustainable management of infrastructures whose execution rate is 68%, the results achieved are: - the implementation of ten (10) environmental and social management plans through compensatory reforestation (2300 plants) as well as training on environmental protection for 500 producers, including 156 women; raising of Sourgou dam and start of rehabilitation works on 02 dams as well as development /rehabilitation works of 150 ha of irrigated perimeters and 23 ha of market gardens; construction of 10 animal passageways. - the proportion of representative and functional Water User Committees is 82% in 2020. The effective establishment and capacity building of these committees has enabled a change in the improvement of the organization of local actors. Regarding water development and developed land, the physical execution rate is 68%. it is noted that: - yields obtained have increased to 3.8 t/ha for rice for an expected target of 2.07t/ ha; 10.9 t/ha for onion for an expected target of 14.375t/ha and 11.6 t/ha for tomato for an expected target of 4.14 t/ha. - As for fish production, an increase in the volume of fish caught was noted to 1,479 kg for an expected target of 847 kg. These results indicate adoption of good practices. Regarding the economic development of agricultural products, the overall execution rate is 68%.Specifically, the volume of fish marketed has increased by 27% against an expected target of 10%.As for household agricultural income, an increase of nearly 200% was noted against a target of 10%. In 2020, no unexpected result was observed. Apart from the need to consider the "Covid 19 pandemic in the project sites, and particularly in the peripheral areas of the city of Ouagadougou. Brief analysis of satisfactions and dissatisfactions : 61.5% of beneficiaries note with satisfaction the support and approach of the project in the management of water and developed land. Regarding difficulties, Water User Committees mainly face the low technical capacity of some members and especially the lack of water at certain times of the year. Changes observed in the context of applying the theory of change in your project:The project was designed on the basis of the theory of change approach. It is based on the principles of Result-Based Management (partnership, responsibility of actors, transparency in implementation, learning, etc.).Integration of perspectives, Environment, Gender, Human rights,…, in the implementation of the project.These themes have been taken into account since the start of project implementation. In terms of considering the "Environment" Capacity building actions are implemented for the benefit of producers on production techniques adapted to climate change (production techniques and methods of using compost, appropriate irrigation techniques, management of pests and pesticides, manufacture and use of biological pesticides, etc.). To reflect resilience in the face of climate change and the efficient management of water for agricultural use, the market gardens to be created for the benefit of women will be equipped with a localized solar pumped irrigation system. As part of the development works, the project continued in 2020 with the implementation of environmental and social management plans to take environmental issues into account. Dams and water protection measures have also been taken to ensure the protection of the water resource. About gender In 2020, most of the data collected was disaggregated by gender. Constructions such as latrine blocks are made with a gender perspective. Blocks are dedicated to men and women, and these latrines have access ramps for people with reduced mobility. Also, to strengthen the productive capacities of women, market gardens using solar energy for pumping have been specifically dedicated to women. The irrigation system used also allows women farmers to reduce their watering chore during production. Regarding "Human Rights"The partners are informed and sensitized each year on issues of fraud, corruption, ethics, etc. in the implementation of the project. This commitment to respect for human rights is included in the clauses of the collaboration protocols signed in 2020 with the technical services. When carrying out work on construction sites, the use of children is clearly prohibited.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
